    • Constructor Detail

      • OMCampaign

        public OMCampaign(int start,
          OMRoom[] rooms,
          int randomNoise)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor for objects of the class OMCampaign. Creates survey campaigns for 7 days in 7 different Rooms using 6 normal rooms and 1 cellar room.
        Parameters:
        start - The timestamp of the first measurement for the simulated campaign, starting with 0 for the first hour of the real value-sets. The unit is [h].
        rooms - An array of seven rooms for the seven days (steps) of the simulated campaign. Should be 6 normal rooms and 1 cellar.
        randomNoise - An integer which defines the random noise that is added to the values. A random noise of 0 means the original values wont be modified. The unit is [%].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If creating log file or writing logs fails.

    • Method Detail

      • getStart

        public int getStart()
        Gets the timestamp of the first measurement for the simulated campaign. The unit is [h].
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the first measurement for the simulated campaign.

      • setStart

        public void setStart(int start)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the timestamp of the first measurement for the simulated campaign. The unit is [h].
        Parameters:
        start - The timestamp of the first measurement for the simulated campaign, 0 equals the first hour of the real value-sets.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If creating log file or writing logs fails.

      • getVariation

        public java.lang.String getVariation()
        Gets a simple string to identify the used rooms and their order in this campaign. For example R1R2C1R3R3R4R6.
        Returns:
        A simple string to identify the used rooms and their order in this campaign.

      • getType

        public OMCampaignType getType()
        Gets the campaign type. The campaign type identifies how many different rooms were used to create this campaign. For example 'Five' means 5 different rooms were used.
        Returns:
        The campaign type.

      • getRandomNoise

        public int getRandomNoise()
        Gets an integer which defines the random noise that is added to the values. A random noise of 0 means the original values wont be modified. The unit is [%].
        Returns:
        An integer which defines the random noise that is added to the values.

      • getRoomPattern

        public OMRoom[] getRoomPattern()
        Gets all rooms and the cellars keeping their order to simplify reconstruction of the campaign later on.

      • getRooms

        public OMRoom[] getRooms()
        Gets an array of rooms of the simulated survey campaign.
        Returns:
        An array of rooms of the simulated survey campaign.

      • setRooms

        public void setRooms(OMRoom[] rooms)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Sets an array of rooms of the simulated survey campaign and triggers a re-calculation of all attributes.
        Parameters:
        rooms - An array of rooms of the simulated survey campaign.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If creating log file or writing logs fails.

      • getRoomValues

        public double[] getRoomValues()
        Gets an array of selected values of all normal rooms. The first values is determined by the start timestamp. The unit is [Bq/m^3].
        Returns:
        An array of selected values of all normal rooms.

      • getCellarValues

        public double[] getCellarValues()
        Gets an array of selected values for the cellar room. The first value is determined by the start timestamp. The unit is [Bq/m^3].
        Returns:
        An array of selected values for the cellar room.

      • calculateAttributes

        public void calculateAttributes()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Calls the setters for all the attributes of the campaign to re-calculate and update them. Call this method always after changes to the radon values. Note: It's not needed to call this after using the OMCampaign.setRooms(), setCellar() or setStart()-methods as modifying values using the setter always triggers the re-calculation of attributes on its own.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If creating log file or writing logs fails.
